intro: Pentagramma maxonii, commonly known as the mountain snowberry, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its berries, which are typically red or black, are edible and attract various wildlife. Pentagramma maxonii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
